definition: mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Your friend has missed the train, but his hand-bag is sti1l here. " Before Mr."
sentences.chinese: 你朋友错过了这个火车，不过他的包还在这。

sentences.english: Spoelstra, however, seemed to miss the most relevant point.
sentences.chinese: 但是，看起来斯波尔斯特拉错过了那个最关键的问题。

sentences.english: I would guess that, in that situation where a percussion player misses a crash.
sentences.chinese: 我想如果一名打击乐演奏者错过了该敲的点。

sentences.english: An auspicious day; referring to the date of a wedding.
sentences.chinese: 今天是不容错过的吉期，适于操办婚事。

sentences.english: It's a pity that you have missed such a wonderful concert.
sentences.chinese: 真遗憾，你错过了这么精彩的一场音乐会。

sentences.english: What if she oversleeps and misses the bus?
sentences.chinese: 假如她睡过头错过班车怎么办？

sentences.english: Even if you don't like flowers, you shouldn't miss the flower exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不喜欢花，这次花展你也不应错过。

sentences.english: If you’d rather not miss out, click here to buy the EBK now.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不想错过这次机会，请点击这里订购。

sentences.english: He muffed a good opportunity for a big contract.
sentences.chinese: 他把签订一项大合同的好机会错过了。

sentences.english: Have I missed special conditions that affect the transitions?
sentences.chinese: 我是否错过了影响转变的特别条件？

sentences.english: In Milan his spectacular shows immediately become the must-see appointment during the men's fashion week.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他的时装秀成为男装时装周中不可错过的品牌。

sentences.english: Much to my vexation, I just missed a chance of visiting China.
sentences.chinese: 错过一个访问中国的机会，真气人。

sentences.english: He's not really on the ball —he lets so many chances slip by.
sentences.chinese: 他确实是不留心，那么多机会都被他错过了。

sentences.english: He muffed a good opportunity for a promotion.
sentences.chinese: 他错过一个晋升的大好机会。

sentences.english: Have you been missing laughing babies and sneezing pandas?
sentences.chinese: 你以前错过看笑不乐知的小宝贝和打喷嚏的熊猫吗？

sentences.english: "It will be unmissable television, " said Green.
sentences.chinese: “这将是不可错过的电视，”格林说。

definition: to fail to live up (to expectations)/unworthy (of trust)/to let down/to betray (hopes)/to disappoint
to delay/to hold up/to waste time/to interfere with
to start over/to do sth all over again
heartbeat/heart rate/(fig.) emotionally affected/aroused (of desire, emotion, interest etc)
to miss narrowly/to let a great opportunity slip
